go_data.justification: RBCC proteins, such as PML and MURF, interact with other proteins through their RING-finger, B-box, and coiled-coil domains.
RBCC proteins have been implicated in signal transduction.
Some RBCC proteins, such as PML, are known to be localized to the nucleus.
MURF, a muscle-specific RBCC protein, is expressed in cardiac and skeletal muscle throughout development.
RBCC proteins contain a RING-finger domain, which is known to be involved in E2-dependent ubiquitination.
